snippet: The United States has won re-election to its seat on the U.N. Human Rights Council, a body that can be a critic of Israel but lenient on countries like Sri Lanka, Sudan and Zimbabwe.
abstract: The United States has won re-election to its seat on the U.N. Human Rights Council, a body that can be a critic of Israel but lenient on countries like Sri Lanka, Sudan and Zimbabwe.

headline.main: Voting for U.N. Rights Council Puts Focus on Records of Panel's Member States

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
